channel.title: A new award
channel.description: Greetings. My proposition is to introduce a new award/badge/cup. I know that there are already plenty, but this award will go to those who are very knowledgeable regarding the RuneScape client/game protocol. There are quite a few members of the forum who have extensive knowledge of the RuneScape client/game protocol whom I won't name but aren't entirely great programmers. They are simply awarded with the Java Guru badge and that's that, regardless of whether or not they are actually knowledgeable Java programmers. I don't expect this to be approved, I just want to bring this to your attention.

item.title: A new award
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I suggested this a long time ago (lets face it, we all know who you are talking about) when sini/dx2 got their badges, and Moparisthebest completely shut the idea down.

Read full topic

item.title: A new award
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Omer, post:3, topic:450107”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=553005.msg4052175#msg4052175 date=1342628239]
I agree with this greatly and we’re actually discussing it. Do you have any suggestions as to what the badge image would be?
[/quote]

I don’t know, really. Does it have to be a pokemon?[/quote]

Ideally. We are all about the pokey men.

Read full topic

item.title: A new award
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Greetings.
My proposition is to introduce a new award/badge/cup. I know that there are already plenty, but this award will go to those who are very knowledgeable regarding the RuneScape client/game protocol.
There are quite a few members of the forum who have extensive knowledge of the RuneScape client/game protocol whom I won’t name but aren’t entirely great programmers. They are simply awarded with the Java Guru badge and that’s that, regardless of whether or not they are actually knowledgeable Java programmers.
I don’t expect this to be approved, I just want to bring this to your attention.

Read full topic
